content:
SecurityTokenHandlerCollection Class

In this Article

Represents a collection of security token handlers.

Syntax

Declaration

public class SecurityTokenHandlerCollection : System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection<System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityTokenHandler>

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection
  • SecurityTokenHandlerCollection

Inherited Members

,

Constructors summary

SecurityTokenHandlerCollection()

Initializes a new instance of the SecurityTokenHandlerCollection class.
SecurityTokenHandlerCollection(IEnumerable<SecurityTokenHandler>)

Initializes a new instance of the SecurityTokenHandlerCollection class with the specified token handlers.
SecurityTokenHandlerCollection(SecurityTokenHandlerConfiguration)

Initializes a new instance of the SecurityTokenHandlerCollection class with the specified configuration.
SecurityTokenHandlerCollection(IEnumerable<SecurityTokenHandler>,SecurityTokenHandlerConfiguration)

Initializes a new instance of the SecurityTokenHandlerCollection class with the specified token handlers and configuration.

Properties summary

Configuration

Gets and sets the base configuration for this security token handler collection.
Item(SecurityToken)

Gets a token handler from this collection that can handle the specified security token.
Item(String)

Gets a token handler from this collection that can handle the specified type identifier.
Item(Type)

Gets the handler from this collection that can handle the specified token type.
TokenTypeIdentifiers

Gets a list of the type identifiers of the tokens handled by the handlers in this collection.
TokenTypes

Gets a list of the types of the tokens handled by handlers in this collection.

Methods summary

AddOrReplace(SecurityTokenHandler)

Adds the specified token handler to this collection. If a handler with the same token type identifier as the specified handler already exists in the collection, it is replaced with the specified handler.
CanReadKeyIdentifierClause(XmlReader)

Returns a value that indicates whether the specified key identifier clause can be read by one of the handlers in this collection or by the base WSSecurityTokenSerializer.
CanReadKeyIdentifierClauseCore(XmlReader)

Returns a value that indicates whether the specified key identifier clause can be read by one of the handlers in the collection or by the base WSSecurityTokenSerializer.
CanReadToken(String)

Returns a value that indicates whether the specified string representation of a token can be read by one of the handlers in this collection.
CanReadToken(XmlReader)

Returns a value that indicates whether the specified token can be read by one of the handlers in this collection.
CanWriteToken(SecurityToken)

Returns a value that indicates whether the specified token can be serialized by one of the handlers in this collection.
ClearItems()

Clears all of the handlers from this collection. (Override of the base class method.)
CreateDefaultSecurityTokenHandlerCollection()

Creates a system default collection of basic security token handlers, each of which has the system default configuration. The token handlers in this collection must be configured with service specific data before they can be used.
CreateDefaultSecurityTokenHandlerCollection(SecurityTokenHandlerConfiguration)

Creates a system default collection of basic security token handlers and associates the specified configuration with the new collection. Each of the handlers has the system default configuration. The token handlers in this collection must be configured with service specific data before they can be used.
CreateToken(SecurityTokenDescriptor)

Creates a token from the specified token descriptor.
InsertItem(Int32,SecurityTokenHandler)

Inserts the specified token handler in this collection at the specified index. (Override of the base class method.)
ReadKeyIdentifierClause(XmlReader)

Deserializes a key identifier clause from the specified XML reader.
ReadKeyIdentifierClauseCore(XmlReader)

Deserializes a key identifier clause from the specified XML reader.
ReadToken(String)

Deserializes a security token from the specified string.
ReadToken(XmlReader)

Deserializes a security token from the specified XML reader.
RemoveItem(Int32)

Removes the handler at the specified index from this collection. (Override of the base class method.)
SetItem(Int32,SecurityTokenHandler)

Replaces the token handler at the specified index in the collection with the specified handler.
ValidateToken(SecurityToken)

Validates the specified security token.
WriteKeyIdentifierClause(XmlWriter,SecurityKeyIdentifierClause)

Serializes the specified key identifier clause to XML.
WriteKeyIdentifierClauseCore(XmlWriter,SecurityKeyIdentifierClause)

Serializes the specified key identifier clause to XML.
WriteToken(SecurityToken)

Serializes the specified security token to a string.
WriteToken(XmlWriter,SecurityToken)

Serializes the specified security token to XML.

Constructors

  • SecurityTokenHandlerCollection()

    Initializes a new instance of the SecurityTokenHandlerCollection class.

    public SecurityTokenHandlerCollection ();

    Remarks

    The new collection does not contain any handlers.

  • SecurityTokenHandlerCollection(IEnumerable<SecurityTokenHandler>)

    Initializes a new instance of the SecurityTokenHandlerCollection class with the specified token handlers.

    public SecurityTokenHandlerCollection (System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityTokenHandler> handlers);

    Parameters

    • handlers
      IEnumerable<SecurityTokenHandler>

      The token handlers with which to initialize the new instance.

    Remarks

    Do not use this constructor to attempt to clone an instance of the SecurityTokenHandlerCollectionclass, use the Clone method instead.

  • SecurityTokenHandlerCollection(SecurityTokenHandlerConfiguration)

    Initializes a new instance of the SecurityTokenHandlerCollection class with the specified configuration.

    public SecurityTokenHandlerCollection (System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityTokenHandlerConfiguration configuration);

    Parameters

    • configuration
      SecurityTokenHandlerConfiguration

      The base configuration to associate with the collection.

    Remarks

    The new collection does not contain any handlers.

  • SecurityTokenHandlerCollection(IEnumerable<SecurityTokenHandler>,SecurityTokenHandlerConfiguration)

    Initializes a new instance of the SecurityTokenHandlerCollection class with the specified token handlers and configuration.

    public SecurityTokenHandlerCollection (System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityTokenHandler> handlers, System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityTokenHandlerConfiguration configuration);

    Parameters

    • handlers
      IEnumerable<SecurityTokenHandler>

      The token handlers with which to initialize the new instance.

    • configuration
      SecurityTokenHandlerConfiguration

      The base configuration to associate with the collection.

    Remarks

    Do not use this constructor to attempt to clone an instance of the SecurityTokenHandlerCollectionclass, use the Clone method instead.

Properties

  • Configuration

    Gets and sets the base configuration for this security token handler collection.

    public System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityTokenHandlerConfiguration Configuration { get; }

    Property Value

    • SecurityTokenHandlerConfiguration

      The configuration for the token handler collection.

  • Item(SecurityToken)

    Gets a token handler from this collection that can handle the specified security token.

    public System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityTokenHandler this[System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityToken token] { get; }

    Parameters

    • token
      SecurityToken

      The token for which the handler should be returned.

    Property Value

    • SecurityTokenHandler

      A token handler that can handle the specified token.

  • Item(String)

    Gets a token handler from this collection that can handle the specified type identifier.

    public System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityTokenHandler this[string tokenTypeIdentifier] { get; }

    Parameters

    • tokenTypeIdentifier
      String

      A URI that identifies the token type.

    Property Value

    • SecurityTokenHandler

      A token handler that can handle tokens that correspond to the specified type identifier.

  • Item(Type)

    Gets the handler from this collection that can handle the specified token type.

    public System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityTokenHandler this[Type tokenType] { get; }

    Parameters

    • tokenType
      Type

      The type of the token to be handled.

    Property Value

    • SecurityTokenHandler

      A token handler that can handle tokens of the specified type.

  • TokenTypeIdentifiers

    Gets a list of the type identifiers of the tokens handled by the handlers in this collection.

    public System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<string> TokenTypeIdentifiers { get; }

    Property Value

    • IEnumerable<String>

      The list of type identifier URIs.

  • TokenTypes

    Gets a list of the types of the tokens handled by handlers in this collection.

    public System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<Type> TokenTypes { get; }

    Property Value

    • IEnumerable<Type>

      The list of types.

Methods

  • AddOrReplace(SecurityTokenHandler)

    Adds the specified token handler to this collection. If a handler with the same token type identifier as the specified handler already exists in the collection, it is replaced with the specified handler.

    public void AddOrReplace (System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityTokenHandler handler);

    Parameters

    • handler
      SecurityTokenHandler

      The token handler to add to the collection.

  • CanReadKeyIdentifierClause(XmlReader)

    Returns a value that indicates whether the specified key identifier clause can be read by one of the handlers in this collection or by the base WSSecurityTokenSerializer.

    public bool CanReadKeyIdentifierClause (System.Xml.XmlReader reader);

    Parameters

    • reader
      XmlReader

      An XML reader positioned at the start element. The reader should not be advanced.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the key identifier clause can be read; otherwise false.

  • CanReadKeyIdentifierClauseCore(XmlReader)

    Returns a value that indicates whether the specified key identifier clause can be read by one of the handlers in the collection or by the base WSSecurityTokenSerializer.

    protected virtual bool CanReadKeyIdentifierClauseCore (System.Xml.XmlReader reader);

    Parameters

    • reader
      XmlReader

      An XML reader positioned at the start element. The reader should not be advanced.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the key identifier clause can be read; otherwise false.

  • CanReadToken(String)

    Returns a value that indicates whether the specified string representation of a token can be read by one of the handlers in this collection.

    public bool CanReadToken (string tokenString);

    Parameters

    • tokenString
      String

      The token represented as a string.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the collection contains a token handler that can read the specified token; otherwise false.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      tokenString is null or an empty string.

    Remarks

    The method invokes the System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityTokenHandler.CanReadToken(String) method on the token handlers (SecurityTokenHandler) in the collection to determine whether the token can be read.

  • CanReadToken(XmlReader)

    Returns a value that indicates whether the specified token can be read by one of the handlers in this collection.

    public bool CanReadToken (System.Xml.XmlReader reader);

    Parameters

    • reader
      XmlReader

      An XML reader positioned at the start element. The reader should not be advanced.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the token can be read; otherwise false.

  • CanWriteToken(SecurityToken)

    Returns a value that indicates whether the specified token can be serialized by one of the handlers in this collection.

    public bool CanWriteToken (System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityToken token);

    Parameters

    • token
      SecurityToken

      The security token to be serialized.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the token can be serialized by one of the handlers; otherwise false.

  • ClearItems()

    Clears all of the handlers from this collection. (Override of the base class method.)

    protected override void ClearItems ();
  • CreateDefaultSecurityTokenHandlerCollection()

    Creates a system default collection of basic security token handlers, each of which has the system default configuration. The token handlers in this collection must be configured with service specific data before they can be used.

    public static System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityTokenHandlerCollection CreateDefaultSecurityTokenHandlerCollection ();

    Returns

    • SecurityTokenHandlerCollection

      A security token handler collection that contains the default, basic security token handlers.

  • CreateDefaultSecurityTokenHandlerCollection(SecurityTokenHandlerConfiguration)

    Creates a system default collection of basic security token handlers and associates the specified configuration with the new collection. Each of the handlers has the system default configuration. The token handlers in this collection must be configured with service specific data before they can be used.

    public static System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityTokenHandlerCollection CreateDefaultSecurityTokenHandlerCollection (System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityTokenHandlerConfiguration configuration);

    Parameters

    • configuration
      SecurityTokenHandlerConfiguration

      The configuration to associate with the handler collection.

    Returns

    • SecurityTokenHandlerCollection

      A security token handler collection that contains the default, basic security token handlers.

  • CreateToken(SecurityTokenDescriptor)

    Creates a token from the specified token descriptor.

    public System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityToken CreateToken (System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityTokenDescriptor tokenDescriptor);

    Parameters

    • tokenDescriptor
      SecurityTokenDescriptor

      The token descriptor from which the token is to be created. Properties of the token descriptor are set before this method is called.

    Returns

    • SecurityToken

      A security token that matches the properties of the token descriptor.

  • InsertItem(Int32,SecurityTokenHandler)

    Inserts the specified token handler in this collection at the specified index. (Override of the base class method.)

    protected override void InsertItem (int index, System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityTokenHandler item);

    Parameters

    • index
      Int32

      The zero-based index at which the handler should be inserted.

    • item
      SecurityTokenHandler

      The token handler to insert.

  • ReadKeyIdentifierClause(XmlReader)

    Deserializes a key identifier clause from the specified XML reader.

    public System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause ReadKeyIdentifierClause (System.Xml.XmlReader reader);

    Parameters

    • reader
      XmlReader

      An XML reader positioned at the start element of the XML to be deserialized into the key identifier clause.

    Returns

    • SecurityKeyIdentifierClause

      The key identifier clause deserialized from the XML.

  • ReadKeyIdentifierClauseCore(XmlReader)

    Deserializes a key identifier clause from the specified XML reader.

    protected virtual System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause ReadKeyIdentifierClauseCore (System.Xml.XmlReader reader);

    Parameters

    • reader
      XmlReader

      An XML reader positioned at the start element of the XML to be deserialized into the key identifier clause.

    Returns

    • SecurityKeyIdentifierClause

      The key identifier clause deserialized from the XML.

  • ReadToken(String)

    Deserializes a security token from the specified string.

    public System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityToken ReadToken (string tokenString);

    Parameters

    • tokenString
      String

      The string from which to deserialize the token.

    Returns

    • SecurityToken

      The token that was deserialized from the specified string.

  • ReadToken(XmlReader)

    Deserializes a security token from the specified XML reader.

    public System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityToken ReadToken (System.Xml.XmlReader reader);

    Parameters

    • reader
      XmlReader

      An XML reader positioned at the start element of the token.

    Returns

    • SecurityToken

      The security token deserialized from the XML.

  • RemoveItem(Int32)

    Removes the handler at the specified index from this collection. (Override of the base class method.)

    protected override void RemoveItem (int index);

    Parameters

    • index
      Int32

      The zero-based index of the handler to remove.

  • SetItem(Int32,SecurityTokenHandler)

    Replaces the token handler at the specified index in the collection with the specified handler.

    protected override void SetItem (int index, System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityTokenHandler item);

    Parameters

    • index
      Int32

      The zero-based index of the element to replace.

    • item
      SecurityTokenHandler

      The new token handler for the element at the specified index.

  • ValidateToken(SecurityToken)

    Validates the specified security token.

    public System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection<System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity> ValidateToken (System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityToken token);

    Parameters

    • token
      SecurityToken

      The token to validate.

    Returns

    • ReadOnlyCollection<ClaimsIdentity>

      The identities that are contained in the token.

  • WriteKeyIdentifierClause(XmlWriter,SecurityKeyIdentifierClause)

    Serializes the specified key identifier clause to XML.

    public void WriteKeyIdentifierClause (System.Xml.XmlWriter writer, System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause keyIdentifierClause);

    Parameters

    • writer
      XmlWriter

      The XML writer.

    • keyIdentifierClause
      SecurityKeyIdentifierClause

      The key identifier clause to serialize.

  • WriteKeyIdentifierClauseCore(XmlWriter,SecurityKeyIdentifierClause)

    Serializes the specified key identifier clause to XML.

    protected virtual void WriteKeyIdentifierClauseCore (System.Xml.XmlWriter writer, System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause keyIdentifierClause);

    Parameters

    • writer
      XmlWriter

      The XML writer.

    • keyIdentifierClause
      SecurityKeyIdentifierClause

      The key identifier clause to serialize.

  • WriteToken(SecurityToken)

    Serializes the specified security token to a string.

    public string WriteToken (System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityToken token);

    Parameters

    • token
      SecurityToken

      The token to serialize.

    Returns

    • String

      The string serialized from the token.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      token is null.

    • InvalidOperationException

      The collection does not contain a handler capable of serializing the specified token.

  • WriteToken(XmlWriter,SecurityToken)

    Serializes the specified security token to XML.

    public void WriteToken (System.Xml.XmlWriter writer, System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityToken token);

    Parameters

    • writer
      XmlWriter

      The XML writer.

    • token
      SecurityToken

      The token to serialize.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      token is null.

      -or-

      writer is null.

    • InvalidOperationException

      The collection does not contain a handler capable of serializing the specified token.
